00625         //Create a temp table...
00626            struct TreeEntry* table = find(tree,table_name);
00627            struct TreeEntry* entry;
00628            //printf("TABLE CREATED, ENTRY CREATED \n");
00629            //IF TABLE DOES NOT EXIST, ERROR!!!
00630            //printf("ERROR CODE: %d", error_status);
00631            if(table == NULL)
00632                 {
00633                         error_status = ERR_TABLE_NOT_FOUND;
00634 
00635                         //LOG COMMENT
00636             sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Processing SET command: TABLE '%s' does not exist.\n", table_name);
00637             logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
00638             return -1;
00639                 }
00640 
00641            //if Entry is not existent - insert an entry...
00642 
00643            else if(table != NULL)
00644                 {
00645                         //printf("TABLE DOES EXIST %d", error_status);
00646                         //Create a temp entry
00647                         entry = find(table->tree, key_name);
00648                         if (entry == NULL){
00649                                 //Insert ENTRY!
00650                                 entry = createTable(key_name);
00651 
00652                                 insert(table->tree, entry);
00653 
00654                                 //LOG COMMENT
00655                 sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Processing SET command: Successful INSERT of key '%s'.\n", key_name);
00656                 logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
00657                         }
00658                         else{
00659                                 //Create a temp entry
00660                                 //Return a pointer to that entry
00661                                 entry = find(table->tree, key_name);
00662                         }
00663 
00664                 }
00665 
00666                 //If the value entered is NULL, this means the user wants to delete the value of the specified key.
00667                                 if(strcmp(value, "NULL")==0){
00668                                         value = NULL;
00669                                  }
00670 
00671                 //If the value entered is NULL, this means we must remove the entry.
00672                 if(value == NULL && table!=NULL)
00673                 {
00674                     //LOG COMMENT
00675             sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Processing SET command: Key '%s' will now be removed.\n", key_name);
00676             logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
00677                         
00678                         //We must change the BST to safely remove a 2D Array called value.
00679                         removeDBEntry(table->tree, key_name);
00680                         error_status = 0;
00681                         errno = error_status;
00682                         sprintf(reply, "%d\n", errno);
00683                     sendall(sock, reply, strlen(reply));
00684                         return 0;
00685 
00686                 }
00687                 //If the value entered is NOT NULL, this means we add the new value.
00688                 else if (value != NULL && table!=NULL){
00689                         //We must change the BST to allow setting a 2D Array called value.              
00690                         setEntryValue(entry, value);
00691                         error_status = 0;
00692                         errno = error_status;
00693                         sprintf(reply, "%d\n", errno);
00694                     sendall(sock, reply, strlen(reply));
00695                         return 0;
00696                         
00697                 }
00698                 //errno = error_status;
00699                 //sprintf(reply, "%d \n", errno);
00700            // sendall(sock, reply, strlen(reply));
00701 
00702 
00703     //LOG COMMENT
00704     sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Processing SET command: Successful - Now Ending. \n");
00705     logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
00706 
00707         //endtime:
00708         printf("handle set time: ");
00709         gettimeofday(&tvhEnd, NULL);
00710         timeval_subtract(&tvhDiff, &tvhEnd, &tvhBegin);
00711         printf("%ld.%06ld seconds\n", tvhDiff.tv_sec, tvhDiff.tv_usec);
00712         return 0;
00713 }
00714         // QUERY COMMAND
00715         // ==============================================================================================
00716         // ==============================================================================================
00717         
00718         else if(strcmp(command, "QUERY")==0)
00719         {
00720                 char str_max_key[60];
00721                 //LOG COMMENT
00722                 sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Processing QUERY command: \n");
00723                 logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
00725                         int error_status;
00726                         sscanf(cmd,"%s %s %s %[^\n]",command,table_name,str_max_key,predicates);
00727                         printf("COMMAND: %s, TABLE-NAME: %s, MAX-KEYS-STRING: %s, MAX-KEYS-INT %d, PREDICATES: %s", command, table_name, str_max_key, atoi(str_max_key), predicates);
00729 
00732 // find the table which holds the configuration
00733 
00734                 struct table *config;
00735                 config = c->tlist;
00736                 int table_exist=0; //0 if it doesn't, 1 if it does
00737 
00738                 //remember value1 is used
00739                         if (lex_status == -1) //this means that the lex failed.
00740                         {
00741                                 errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00742                                 sprintf(reply, "%d\n", errno);
00743                                 printf("VALUE OF reply, errno: %s %d", reply, errno);
00744                                 sendall(sock, reply, strlen(reply));
00745                                 return -1;
00746                         }
00747                 // ================================================================================
00748                 while(config != NULL){
00749 
00750                 sprintf(holder,"[LOG]  LINKED_LIST: Checking into the link list\n");
00751                 logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
00752                         if (!strcmp(table_name,config->table_name)){
00753                         sprintf(holder,"[LOG]  LINKED_LIST: Table has been found\n");
00754                         logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
00755                                 table_exist =1;
00756                                 break;
00757                         }
00758                         else{
00759                                 config = config->next;
00760                         }
00761                 }
00762                 // if the table doesn't exist we will set an error code and return error code
00763                 if (!table_exist){
00764                         sprintf(holder,"[LOG]  LINKED_LIST:Table does not exist\n");
00765                         logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
00766 
00767                         error_status = ERR_TABLE_NOT_FOUND;
00768                         errno = error_status;
00769                         sprintf(reply, "%d\n", errno);
00770                         sendall(sock, reply, strlen(reply));
00771                         return -1;
00772                 }
00773 
00775   //Initialize all temp variables
00776   char keys[50][25];
00777   char all_matching_keys[50][25];
00778 
00779   int value_of_type_int_BST;
00780   int value_of_type_int_Query;
00781 
00782   int i,j,no_of_predicates; //loop for query  //i-> BST and j->query
00783   int k=0; //loop for keys
00784   int counter2=0, counter3=0,  flag=0;
00785 
00786   int  temp_count_keys_to_match_predicate;
00787   int counter_to_check_array_match = 0;
00788 
00790 
00792  /*------------------------------------------Invalid Query- if the col names do not match-------------------------*/
00793   no_of_predicates=c->totPredicates/4;
00794   for(j=0; j< c->totPredicates; j+=4)
00795   {
00796     for(i=1; i<=tl->row_index; i+=4)
00797     {
00798   if(strcmp( c->predicates[j],config->array_config[i])==0)
00799   {
00800     //ok to continue
00801     flag=1;
00802     counter3++; //but if the same name exists in the BST?
00803   }
00804     }
00805     if(flag==1){
00806     flag=0;
00807     }
00808   }
00809   if(counter3!=no_of_predicates)
00810   {
00811     printf("Invalid Query Column names do not match:%d",counter3 );
00812     errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00813     sprintf(reply, "%d\n", errno);
00814     sendall(sock, reply, strlen(reply));
00815     return -1; //when integrated to the server, error number will be returned
00816   }
00817 
00818   /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00819 
00820 
00821   printf("\n 1");
00822    for(j=0; j< c->totPredicates; j+=4)//query
00823   {
00824      int count_keys_to_match_predicate=0; //resetting the counter
00825     printf("\n Forgot to print :(");
00826 
00827   for(i=1; i<=config->row_index; i+=4)  //BST
00828   {  printf("\n 2");
00829   if(strcmp( c->predicates[j],config->array_config[i])==0) //if the col name matches in the BST
00830   {   printf("\n 3");
00831 
00832   if(strcmp( c->predicates[j+1], "<")==0) //if the operator matches
00833     {
00834           printf("\n 4");
00835 /*----------------------------------------------------INVALID QUERY---------------------------------------------------------*/
00836         //check if the value is assigned to the correct operator depending on the datatype
00837           if(strcmp( c->predicates[j+3],"char")==0)
00838           {
00839               printf("\n Invalid Query:char for <\n");
00840             errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00841             sprintf(reply, "%d\n", errno);
00842             sendall(sock, reply, strlen(reply));
00843             return -1;
00844           }
00845 
00846 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00847         //do the conversion of the string here...already know that it is int
00848         value_of_type_int_BST = atoi(config->array_config[i+1]);
00849         value_of_type_int_Query = atoi( c->predicates[j+2]);
00850 
00851         if(value_of_type_int_BST < value_of_type_int_Query ) //if the value matches....still in one  key-value pair
00852             { //YES
00853             //store in array
00854             printf("\n 5");
00855             strcpy(keys[k], config->array_config[i-1]);
00856 
00857 
00858               printf("\n Key : %s", keys[k]);
00859               printf("\n stringBST : %s", config->array_config[i]);
00860                 k++;
00861               printf("\nvalue of k - %d ", k);
00862             //traverse through the array to keeping checking for more
00863         }
00864       //NO - traverse through the array to keeping inserting more
00865 
00866 
00867     }
00868 
00869   else  if(strcmp( c->predicates[j+1], ">")==0)
00870   {
00871       printf("\n 6");
00872 
00873  /*----------------------------------------------------INVALID QUERY---------------------------------------------------------*/
00874         //check if the value is assigned to the correct operator depending on the datatype
00875           if(strncmp( c->predicates[j+3],"char",4)==0)
00876           {
00877 
00878               printf("\n Invalid Query:char for >\n");
00879             errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00880             sprintf(reply, "%d\n", errno);
00881             sendall(sock, reply, strlen(reply));
00882             return -1;
00883           }
00884 
00885 
00886          // DOUBT :  if the column value is not of the correct type,
00887 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00888 
00889         value_of_type_int_BST = atoi(config->array_config[i+1]);
00890         value_of_type_int_Query = atoi( c->predicates[j+2]);
00891 
00892         if(value_of_type_int_BST > value_of_type_int_Query )
00893 
00894       { //YES
00895         //store in array
00896         printf("\n 7");
00897         strcpy(keys[k],config->array_config[i-1]);
00898         printf("\n Key : %s", keys[k]);
00899         printf("\n stringBST : %s", config->array_config[i]);
00900          k++;
00901         printf("\nvalue of k - %d ", k);
00902         //traverse through the array to keeping checking for more
00903     }
00904   //NO - traverse through the array to keeping checking for more
00905 
00906 
00907   }
00908 
00909   else  if(strcmp( c->predicates[j+1],"=")==0)
00910   {
00911   printf("\n 8");
00912 
00913      if(strcmp( c->predicates[j+3], "char")==0)
00914       {
00915       if(strcmp(config->array_config[i+1], c->predicates[j+2])==0)
00916       {
00917                  //YES
00918                 //store in array
00919 
00920                 strcpy(keys[k], config->array_config[i-1]);
00921                 printf("\n Key : %s", keys[k]);
00922                 printf("\n stringBST : %s", config->array_config[i]);
00923                 k++;
00924                 printf("\nvalue of k - %d ", k);
00925                 //traverse through the array to keeping checking for more
00926 
00927           //NO - traverse through the array to keeping checking for more
00928 
00929 
00930         }
00931       }
00932   else if (strcmp(c->predicates[j+3], "int")==0)
00933   {
00934     value_of_type_int_BST = atoi(config->array_config[i+1]);
00935     value_of_type_int_Query = atoi( c->predicates[j+2]);
00936 
00937         if(value_of_type_int_BST == value_of_type_int_Query )
00938       {
00939                 { //YES
00940                 //store in array
00941 
00942                 strcpy(keys[k], config->array_config[i-1]);
00943                 printf("\n Key : %s", keys[k]);
00944                 printf("\n stringBST : %s", config->array_config[i]);
00945                 k++;
00946                 printf("\nvalue of k - %d ", k);
00947                 //traverse through the array to keeping checking for more
00948             }
00949           //NO - traverse through the array to keeping checking for more
00950         }
00951   }
00952   }
00953   else{
00954         printf("\n Invalid Query - if the operator does not match <, > or =");
00955     printf("\n 9" );
00956     errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00957     sprintf(reply, "%d\n", errno);
00958     sendall(sock, reply, strlen(reply));
00959   }
00960   counter2++;
00961 
00962   }//end of if
00963 
00964   printf("\n 10" );
00965 
00966   }//end of BST
00967 
00968   printf("\n 11 ");
00969 
00970 
00971   } //end of query
00972 
00973   printf("\n 12");
00974 
00975 printf("\n printing a key multiple times: %s \n", keys[i]);
00976  printf("\n ----------------------------------------------------");
00977   int all_matches=0;
00978   int strKeys_counter, keys_counter;
00979   /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00980   for(strKeys_counter=0; strKeys_counter < config->numkeys; strKeys_counter++)  //stringKeys
00981   {    int matches_counter=0;
00982     for(keys_counter=0; keys_counter<k; keys_counter++) //keys
00983     {
00984       if(strcmp(config->array_keys[strKeys_counter],keys[keys_counter])==0)
00985       {
00986 
00987         matches_counter++;
00988         printf(" no_of matches %d\n ", matches_counter);
00989       }
00990     }
00991 
00992         if(matches_counter == no_of_predicates)
00993         {
00994 
00995           strcpy(all_matching_keys[all_matches], config->array_keys[strKeys_counter]);
00996                  printf("\n ----------------------------------------------------");
00997            printf("\n printing each key once:%s \n", all_matching_keys[all_matches]);
00998           all_matches++;
00999 
01000         }
01001   }
01002 
01004 //Declare a 1D array to send back to the client.
01005 char *keys_sent_to_the_client = (char *)malloc(800);
01006 for(i=0; i<all_matches; i++)
01007     {
01008     printf("Keys : %s\n",all_matching_keys[i]);
01009     strcat(keys_sent_to_the_client, all_matching_keys[i]);
01010     strcat(keys_sent_to_the_client, "  ");
01011     }
01012 
01013     printf("Key1D : %s\n",keys_sent_to_the_client);
01015                 sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Ending QUERY command: \n");
01016                 logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
01017 
01018                 //%d -> str_keys_found
01019                 //%s ->str_keys_array
01020                 errno = 0;
01021                 sprintf(reply, "%d %d %s\n", errno, all_matches, keys_sent_to_the_client);
01022                         sendall(sock, reply, strlen(reply));
01023                         return 0;
01024 
01025 
01026         }
01027 
01028         free(command);
01029         free(table_name);
01030         free(key_name);
01031         free(value);
01032         free(username);
01033         free(password);
01034         free(reply);
01035 
01036         return 0;
01037 }
01038 
01046 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
01047 {
01048         printf("\n>> Server starting\n");
01049         char holder[100];
01050 
01051         char str[200];
01052         strcpy(str,"Server-");
01053         strcat(str, currentDateTime());
01054         strcat(str,".log");
01055         if (LOGGING == 2){
01056                 fpSERVER = fopen(str, "w");
01057         }
01058 
01059         //LOG COMMENT
01060         sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Server Starting: ... \n");
01061         logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
01062         //CREATE THE DATABASE POINTER - This pointer will be the link between the server and the                database.
01063         struct TreeDB* tree = createTreeDB();
01064 
01065         //LOG COMMENT
01066         sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Server Starting: Database Created \n");
01067         logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
01069 
01070         // Process command line arguments.
01071         // This program expects exactly one argument: the config file name.
01072         assert(argc > 0);
01073         if (argc != 2) {
01074                 printf("Usage %s <config_file>\n", argv[0]);
01075                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
01076         }
01077         //This stores the name of the CONFIG FILE
01078         extern FILE *yyin;
01079         FILE *f;
01080         char tempStr[30];
01081         strcpy(tempStr, argv[1]);
01082         f = fopen(tempStr,"r");
01083         yyin = f;
01084 
01085         //READ THE CONFIG FILE HERE using YACC and LEX
01086         while(! feof(yyin) )  {
01087                 int status = yyparse();
01088               if (status!= 0){
01089                   status = -1;
01090                         printf(">> Error processing config file.\n");
01091                         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
01092               }
01093         }
01094 
01095         //If there are no errors parsing from YACC and LEX, we must now check for missing and duplicates.
01096         if (strcmp(c->host,"$$$")==0 || strcmp(c->password,"$$$")==0 || c->port == 0 || strcmp(c->username,"$$$")==0 || c->num_tables == 0)
01097         {
01098                 printf(">> Error processing config file.\n");
01099                                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
01100         }
01101 
01102         //If we get here, we do not have errors in the config file, and we can continue.
01103         config_params params;
01104         int status;
01105         c->tlist = tl;
01106         strcpy(params.password, c->password);
01107         strcpy(params.username, c->username);
01108         strcpy(params.server_host, c->host);
01109         params.server_port = c->port;
01110 
01111 
01112         //Check Number of Columns!
01113         struct table *temp;
01114 
01115       printf("Configuration:\n Host: %s, port: %d, data directory: %s\n",
01116          c->host, c->port);
01117 
01118         temp = c->tlist;
01119         printf("  Table(s):\n");
01120         while(temp != NULL){
01121 
01122           printf("      %s \n",temp->table_name);
01123 
01124         //PRINT THE 2D Array for EACH TABLE
01125         int a;
01126         for (a = 0; a < temp->row_index; a++)
01127                 {
01128                 printf("        %s %d \n", temp->array_config[a], temp->numCols);
01129             }
01130             printf("\n");
01131 
01132 
01133         temp=temp->next;
01134         }
01135         printf("\n");
01136 
01137 
01138         //IF THERE ARE NO ERRORS PROCESSING THE CONFIG FILE, WE STORE THE TABLES IN THE DATABASE.
01139         //Insert Configuration Tables
01140 
01141                 int counter;
01142                 for(counter = 0; counter < c->num_tables;counter++)
01143                 {
01144                         struct TreeEntry* table = createTable(c->all_table_names[counter]);
01145                         insert(tree, table);
01146                 }
01147 
01149         //LOG MESSAGE 2
01150 
01151         sprintf(holder,"[LOG] Server on %s:%d\n", params.server_host,params.server_port);
01152         logger(fpSERVER, holder,LOGGING);
01153         //LOG(("Server on %s:%d\n", params.server_host,params.server_port));
01154 
01156 
01157 
01158         // Create a socket.
01159         int listensock = socket(PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
01160         if (listensock < 0) {
01161                 printf("Error creating socket.\n");
01162                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
01163         }
01164 
01165         // Allow listening port to be reused if defunct.
01166         int yes = 1;
01167         status = setsockopt(listensock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &yes, sizeof yes);
01168         if (status != 0) {
01169                 printf("Error configuring socket.\n");
01170                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
01171         }
01172 
01173         // Bind it to the listening port.
01174         struct sockaddr_in listenaddr;
01175         memset(&listenaddr, 0, sizeof listenaddr);
01176         listenaddr.sin_family = AF_INET;
01177         listenaddr.sin_port = htons(params.server_port);
01178         inet_pton(AF_INET, params.server_host, &(listenaddr.sin_addr)); // bind to local IP address
01179         status = bind(listensock, (struct sockaddr*) &listenaddr, sizeof listenaddr);
01180         if (status != 0) {
01181                 printf("Error binding socket.\n");
01182                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
01183         }
01184 
01185         // Listen for connections.
01186         status = listen(listensock, MAX_LISTENQUEUELEN);
01187         if (status != 0) {
01188                 printf("Error listening on socket.\n");
01189                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
01190         }
01191 
01192         // Listen loop.
01193         int wait_for_connections = 1;
01194         while (wait_for_connections) {
01195                 // Wait for a connection.
01196                 struct sockaddr_in clientaddr;
01197                 socklen_t clientaddrlen = sizeof clientaddr;
01198                 int clientsock = accept(listensock, (struct sockaddr*)&clientaddr, &clientaddrlen);
01199                 if (clientsock < 0) {
01200                         printf("Error accepting a connection.\n");
01201                         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
01202                 }
01203 
01205                 //LOG MESSAGE 3
01206                 sprintf(holder,"[LOG] Got a connection from %s:%d.\n", inet_ntoa(clientaddr.sin_addr), clientaddr.sin_port);
01207                 logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
01208                 //LOG(("Got a connection from %s:%d.\n", inet_ntoa(clientaddr.sin_addr), clientaddr.sin_port));
01210 
01211                 //Heindrik: BEGIN TIMING handle_command
01212                 struct timeval tvsysBegin, tvsysEnd, tvsysDiff;
01213                 gettimeofday(&tvsysBegin, NULL);
01214                 // ********************************************
01215 
01216                 // Get commands from client.
01217                 int wait_for_commands = 1;
01218                 do {
01219                         // Read a line from the client.
01220                         char cmd[MAX_CMD_LEN];
01221                         int status = recvline(clientsock, cmd, MAX_CMD_LEN);
01222                         if (status != 0) {
01223                                 // Either an error occurred or the client closed the connection.
01224                                 wait_for_commands = 0;
01225                         } else {
01226                                 // Handle the command from the client.
01227 
01228                         sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Declarings variables \n");
01229                         logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
01230 
01231                                 // * * *  Implement YACC AND LEX parser here!
01232                                 char *command = (char *)malloc(MAX_KEY_LEN);
01233                                 char *table_name = (char *)malloc(MAX_TABLE_LEN);
01234                                 char *key_name= (char *)malloc(MAX_KEY_LEN);
01235                                 char *predicates = (char *)malloc(100);
01236                                 char *value= (char *)malloc(MAX_VALUE_LEN);
01237                                 char *username = (char *)malloc(MAX_USERNAME_LEN);
01238                                 char *password = (char *)malloc(MAX_ENC_PASSWORD_LEN);
01239                                 char *reply = (char *)malloc(MAX_CMD_LEN);
01240 
01241 
01242                                 sscanf(cmd,"%s %s %s %[^\n]",command,table_name,key_name,value);
01243 
01244 
01245                                 int lex_status = 0;
01246                                 if(strcmp(command, "SET")==0)
01247                                 {
01248                                 sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Checking within YACC and LEX \n");
01249                                 logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
01250                                         ss_scan_string(value);
01251                                         lex_status = ssparse();
01252 
01253                                         if (lex_status != 0)
01254                                         {
01255                                                 lex_status = -1;
01256                                                 printf("WRONG! lex_status is %d \n", lex_status);
01257                                                 //errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
01258                                                 //return -1;
01259                                         }
01260                                         else
01261                                         {
01262                                                 printf("success, error status is %d \n", lex_status);
01263                                         }
01264 
01265                                         sslex_destroy();
01266                                 }
01267                                 else if(strcmp(command, "QUERY")==0)
01268                                 {
01269                                 sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Checking within YACC and LEX \n");
01270                                 logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
01271                                         qq_scan_string(value);
01272                                         lex_status = qqparse();
01273 
01274                                         if (lex_status != 0)
01275                                         {
01276                                                 lex_status = -1;
01277                                                 printf("WRONG! lex_status is %d \n", lex_status);
01278                                                 //errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
01279                                                 //return -1;
01280                                         }
01281                                         else
01282                                         {
01283                                                 printf("success, error status is %d \n", lex_status);
01284                                         }
01285 
01286                                         qqlex_destroy();
01287                                 }
01288                         sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Calling handle command \n");
01289                         logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
01290                                 int status = handle_command(clientsock, cmd, tree, params, lex_status);
01291                                 if (status != 0)
01292                                         wait_for_commands = 0; // Oops.  An error occured.
01293                         }
01294                 } while (wait_for_commands);
01295 
01296                 // Close the connection with the client.
01297                 close(clientsock);
01298 
01299                 //endtime:
01300                 printf("handle system time: ");
01301                 gettimeofday(&tvsysEnd, NULL);
01302                 timeval_subtract(&tvsysDiff, &tvsysEnd, &tvsysBegin);
01303                 printf("%ld.%06ld seconds\n", tvsysDiff.tv_sec, tvsysDiff.tv_usec);
01305                 //LOG MESSAGE 4
01306                 sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Closed connection from %s:%d.\n", inet_ntoa(clientaddr.sin_addr), clientaddr.sin_port);
01307                 logger(fpSERVER,holder,LOGGING);
01308                 //LOG(("Closed connection from %s:%d.\n", inet_ntoa(clientaddr.sin_addr), clientaddr.sin_port));
01310         }
01311 
01312         // Stop listening for connections.
01313         close(listensock);
01314 
01315         //CLOSE FILE!
01316         fclose(fpSERVER);
01317 
01318         deleteTreeDB(tree);
01319         free(tree);
01320 
01321         return EXIT_SUCCESS;
01322 }
